camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: The hostname. The default value is 0.0.0.0. Setting this option on the component will use the component configured value as default.

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: The port number. The default value is 9292. Setting this option on the component will use the component configured value as default.

camel.sink.path.resourceUri.name: camel.sink.path.resourceUri
camel.sink.path.resourceUri.description: Name of the websocket channel to use

camel.sink.endpoint.maxBinaryMessageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxBinaryMessageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.maxBinaryMessageSize.description: Can be used to set the size in bytes that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be accept before closing. (Default is -1 - or unlimited)

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.sendTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.sendTimeout.description: Timeout in millis when sending to a websocket channel. The default timeout is 30000 (30 seconds).

camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll
camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll.description: To send to all websocket subscribers. Can be used to configure on endpoint level, instead of having to use the WebsocketConstants.SEND_TO_ALL header on the message.

camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize
camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize.description: Set the buffer size of the websocketServlet, which is also the max frame byte size (default 8192)

camel.sink.endpoint.maxIdleTime.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxIdleTime
camel.sink.endpoint.maxIdleTime.description: Set the time in ms that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be idle before closing. (default is 300000)

camel.sink.endpoint.maxTextMessageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxTextMessageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.maxTextMessageSize.description: Can be used to set the size in characters that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be accept before closing.

camel.sink.endpoint.minVersion.name: camel.sink.endpoint.minVersion
camel.sink.endpoint.minVersion.description: Can be used to set the minimum protocol version accepted for the websocketServlet. (Default 13 - the RFC6455 version)

camel.sink.endpoint.allowedOrigins.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowedOrigins
camel.sink.endpoint.allowedOrigins.description: The CORS allowed origins. Use to allow all.

camel.sink.endpoint.enableJmx.name: camel.sink.endpoint.enableJmx
camel.sink.endpoint.enableJmx.description: If this option is true, Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.

camel.component.websocket.host.name: camel.component.websocket.host
camel.component.websocket.host.description: The hostname. The default value is 0.0.0.0

camel.component.websocket.port.name: camel.component.websocket.port
camel.component.websocket.port.description: The port number. The default value is 9292

camel.component.websocket.lazyStartProdu.name: camel.component.websocket.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.websocket.lazyStartProdu.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.websocket.autowiredEnabl.name: camel.component.websocket.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.websocket.autowiredEnabl.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.websocket.enableJmx.name: camel.component.websocket.enableJmx
camel.component.websocket.enableJmx.description: If this option is true, Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.

camel.component.websocket.maxThreads.name: camel.component.websocket.maxThreads
camel.component.websocket.maxThreads.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in server thread pool. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9. The default values for maxThreads is 1 2 noCores.

camel.component.websocket.minThreads.name: camel.component.websocket.minThreads
camel.component.websocket.minThreads.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in server thread pool. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9. The default values for minThreads is 1.

camel.component.websocket.threadPool.name: camel.component.websocket.threadPool
camel.component.websocket.threadPool.description: To use a custom thread pool for the server. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9.

camel.component.websocket.sslKeyPassword.name: camel.component.websocket.sslKeyPassword
camel.component.websocket.sslKeyPassword.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

camel.component.websocket.useGlobalSslCo.name: camel.component.websocket.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.websocket.useGlobalSslCo.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
